greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Main diagonal of triangle defined in A308178.
comment: Theorem: This is a permutation of the nonnegative integers. [The proof is analogous to that for A286295.]
Conjecture: There is a unique fixed point at n=0, and the positive integers form one "cycle", namely (... 59 27 15 9 12 13 8 4 1 3 2 5 6 7 11 14 17 23 30 16 22 19 29 24 38 ...).
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 28 2019
